UI_visible_response: "Black jails" refer to secret detention centers in China, often controlled by local politicians, where individuals are detained by the state without access to legal process or representation1. These facilities have been described as unlawful systems used to detain petitioners, aiming to protect government officials at various administrative levels2. Large numbers of Chinese citizens have reportedly been held incommunicado for days or months in these harsh conditions, which include crowded sleeping quarters, unsanitary conditions, and poor quality food4. Additionally, physical abuse within these jails is widespread and can be very serious7.
traffic_visible_response: "Black jails" refer to secret detention centers in China, often controlled by local politicians, where individuals are detained by the state without access to legal process or representation [[1]]. These facilities have been described as unlawful systems used to detain petitioners, aiming to protect government officials at various administrative levels [[2]]. Large numbers of Chinese citizens have reportedly been held incommunicado for days or months in these harsh conditions, which include crowded sleeping quarters, unsanitary conditions, and poor quality food [[4]]. Additionally, physical abuse within these jails is widespread and can be very serious [[7]].
